intro: Bernardia mexicana var. albida, commonly known as the white-flowered bernardia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub habit. The plant features small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in spring. Its leaves are leathery and elliptical, providing a dense canopy. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in humid, forested areas.
